elements.desc:
`<iron-input>` adds two-way binding and custom validators using `Polymer.IronValidatorBehavior`
to `<input>`.

### Two-way binding

By default you can only get notified of changes to an `input`'s `value` due to user input:

    <input value="{{myValue::input}}">

`iron-input` adds the `bind-value` property that mirrors the `value` property, and can be used
for two-way data binding. `bind-value` will notify if it is changed either by user input or by script.

    <input is="iron-input" bind-value="{{myValue}}">

### Custom validators

You can use custom validators that implement `Polymer.IronValidatorBehavior` with `<iron-input>`.

    <input is="iron-input" validator="my-custom-validator">

### Stopping invalid input

It may be desirable to only allow users to enter certain characters. You can use the
`prevent-invalid-input` and `allowed-pattern` attributes together to accomplish this. This feature
is separate from validation, and `allowed-pattern` does not affect how the input is validated.

    <!-- only allow characters that match [0-9] -->
    <input is="iron-input" prevent-invalid-input allowed-pattern="[0-9]">

events.desc: The `iron-input-validate` event is fired whenever `validate()` is called.

jsdoc.description: The `iron-input-validate` event is fired whenever `validate()` is called.
jsdoc.orig:
The `iron-input-validate` event is fired whenever `validate()` is called.
  @event iron-input-validate

events.name: iron-input-validate

properties.name: allowedPattern
properties.desc: Regular expression to match valid input characters.

properties.name: bindValue
properties.desc: Use this property instead of `value` for two-way data binding.

properties.name: hasValidator
invalid
properties.desc: True if the last call to `validate` is invalid.

properties.name: preventInvalidInput
properties.desc:
Set to true to prevent the user from entering invalid input. The new input characters are
matched with `allowedPattern` if it is set, otherwise it will use the `pattern` attribute if
set, or the `type` attribute (only supported for `type=number`).

properties.name: validate
properties.desc:
Returns true if `value` is valid. The validator provided in `validator` will be used first,
then any constraints.

return.desc: True if the value is valid.

properties.name: validator
properties.desc: Name of the validator to use.

properties.name: validatorType
properties.desc: Namespace for this validator.

properties.name: _bindValueChanged
_getValidity
properties.desc:
Returns true if `value` is valid.  By default, it is passed
to the validator's `validate()` function, if a validator is set. You
should override this method if you want to implement custom validity
logic for your element.

iron-input.desc:
`<iron-input>` adds two-way binding and custom validators using `Polymer.IronValidatorBehavior`
to `<input>`.

### Two-way binding

By default you can only get notified of changes to an `input`'s `value` due to user input:
